# Specific test functions


## Load the koboLoops Package

```{r, results='hide', message=FALSE,warning=FALSE,error=FALSE}
library("visualisationIMPACT")
```

## Example data frame
Here we are downloading from a file in test repository. 


```{r}
data<-read.csv("../tests/testthat/testdata.csv")

```

## Barchart with average (numerical-categorical)

### Calculate average, min and max
```{r,eval=F}

dependent.var = "hhnumberindividuals"
independent.var = "region" 

result <- data %>% select(c( independent.var , dependent.var)) %>% group_by_(independent.var) %>% summarise_all(c(average=mean,min=min,max=max))

```


### Print barchart

```{r,eval=F}
barchart_average(result, region, average, min, max)

```


##Grouped barchart with percentages

```{r,eval=F}
regions.value=c("capitalcentral","capitalcentral", "north","north","south","south","west","west")
choices_value=c("yes","no","yes","no","yes","no","yes","no")
min_value <- result_percent-5
max_value <- result_percent+5
result_percent= c(50,50, 30, 70, 45,55, 90,10)
table_result_percent <- data.frame(region=regions.value, choice=choices_value, percents=result_percent, min=min_value, max=max_value)
```


```{r,eval=F}
grouped_barchart_percent(table_result_percent,region,choice,percent, min, max)
```
